availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Maxey (Hancock County Methodist minister)

body.p: A Kentucky farmer and Methodist minister. Lived in Hancock County, Kentucky in 1860. Married twice, first to Catherine "Kitty" Blincoe Maxey, and a second time to Martha S. Wilson Maxey. Father of Mary E. Maxey, Kitty Maxey, Leonedas Maxey, J. M. Maxey, J. F. Maxey, Martha Maxey, S. E. Maxey, V. A. Maxey, E L Maxey, and Mettie Maxey. Founding member of the Hancock Pond Draining Company in 1850. Member of the Masonic Order at Hancock Lodge, No. 115 in Hawesville, Kentucky.

bibl.p: "An Act to Incorporate the Hancock Pond Draining Company, and amend the charter of the Jefferson Pond Draining Company," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Passed at December Session, 1849 (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G. Hodges & Co.â€“ State Printers, 1849), 390-394; Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville, Commencing on Monday, the 21st Day of October, 1867 (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 111-112; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 33; "William Bondurant Maxey," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=40681975&ref=acom) (accessed on April 5, 2017).
